page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = email_pop_retr(P pResult ,P pSocket ,N nMessage [,L lDelete [,N nBlockSize [,L lStatus ]]])

argument.name: Result_Flag
argument.description: .T. = The message was successfully downloaded. .F. = The message was not downloaded.

argument.name: pResult
argument.description: A pointer variable that is populated by EMAIL_POP_RETR().

item.name: .headers
item.description: Contains the headers for the entire message.

item.name: .message
item.description: contains the entire text of the message

item.name: .nBytes
item.description: contains the number of bytes that the server reported is in the message

item.name: .content_type
item.description: has the value of the "content-type:" field from the headers.

item.name: .parts
item.description: If the message has many parts (Content-Type: Multipart/Alternative or similar), there will be an array named parts in the pMessage structure. Each element of this array contains: headers, message, content_type, and perhaps another parts array. The parts array will usually be there if the message contains html or attachments, as is seen below.

argument.name: pSocket
argument.description: A pointer variable that is populated by EMAIL_POP_OPEN().

argument.name: nMessage
argument.description: The message number that you want to retrieve from the server. Numeric

argument.name: lDelete
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .F. .T. = The message will be deleted from the server after it is downloaded .F. = The message is not deleted.

argument.name: nBlockSize
argument.description: Numeric. Optional. Default = 64KB. The number of bytes that should be retrieved from the server at one time.

page.description: Retrieve one message from the server. pSocket.s must be an open connection
page.discussion: The EMAIL_POP_RETR() function retrieves a single message from a POP3 server. The connection must have been previously opened with EMAIL_POP_OPEN().
page.example: DIM pSocket as P DIM pMessage as P ? email_pop_open(pSocket, "mail.mycompany.com", "john_doe", "sneaky") = .T. ? pSocket.nMessages = 5 ? email_pop_retr(pMessage, pSocket, 2) = .T. ? properties_enum(pMessage) = headers message nBytes content_type parts

section.title: Example 2
section.example: ? pMessage.content_type = "Multipart/Mixed" ? pMessage.parts1.content_type = "Multipart/Alternative" ? pMessage.parts1.parts1.content_type = "Text/Plain" ? pMessage.parts1.parts1.message = "This is a plain text email" ? pMessage.parts1.parts2.content_type = "Text/Html"
